content: This chapter introduces the basic concepts of economics, including scarcity, opportunity cost, and the factors of production.
This chapter explores the forces of supply and demand and how they determine prices in a market economy.
This chapter examines the structure and performance of the Canadian economy, including key industries and economic indicators.
This chapter explores the role of government in the economy, including taxation, regulation, and public spending.
This chapter examines the benefits and challenges of international trade and Canada's role in the global economy.
